{

}

post.description:
Creates a set of nodes using default settings for a hierarchy. The nodes to be created are specified in an array of Strings in the content with a comma delimiter for nodes in the path.
Optionally the comma delimiter may be changed by a query parameter.
Optionally may specify to just return the list of nodes that would be created without actually creating them, allowing the user to check the format of the input.
Returns an array list of all node paths that are created from the content input.
The Location header will be set to GET the full node listing for the hierarchy.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of strings, each string is an entire path of a node to be created. For example, a content of "["a,b","c,d"]" would create 4 nodes: Level 1 nodes a and c, as well as Level 2 nodes b and d. Node b would be the child of node a. Node d would be child of node c. Nodes that already exist will not be duplicated.
